intro: Wurmbea tenuis subsp. australis, commonly known as the slender swamp lily, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the genus Wurmbea, which is part of the family Asparagaceae. This subspecies is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in coastal regions. The plant is adapted to humid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
